form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Death Tax Repeal Act of 2015.

section.header: Repeal of estate and generation-skipping transfer taxes

subsection.text: Subchapter C of chapter 11 of subtitle B of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:
Except as provided in subsection (b), this chapter shall not apply to the estates of decedents dying on or after the date of the enactment of the Death Tax Repeal Act of 2015.

subsection.header: Certain Distributions From Qualified Domestic Trusts
subsection.text: In applying section 2056A with respect to the surviving spouse of a decedent dying before the date of the enactment of the Death Tax Repeal Act of 2015â€”

paragraph.text: section 2056A(b)(1)(A) shall not apply to distributions made after the 10-year period beginning on such date, and
section 2056A(b)(1)(B) shall not apply on or after such date.

subsection.text: Subchapter G of chapter 13 of subtitle B of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.text: This chapter shall not apply to generation-skipping transfers on or after the date of the enactment of the Death Tax Repeal Act of 2015.

subsection.header: Treatment of certain transfers in trust
subsection.text: Section 2511 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Treatment of certain transfers in trust
subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this section and except as provided in regulations, a transfer in trust shall be treated as a taxable gift under section 2503, unless the trust is treated as wholly owned by the donor or the donorâ€™s spouse under subpart E of part I of subchapter J of chapter 1.

the amount of the tentative tax which would be determined under the rate schedule set forth in section 2502(a)(2) if the amount with respect to which such tentative tax is to be computed were $5,000,000, reduced by
Section 2505 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:
In the case of any calendar year after 2011, the dollar amount in subsection (a)(1) shall be increased by an amount equal toâ€”

subparagraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for such calendar year by substituting calendar year 2010 for calendar year 1992 in subparagraph (B) thereof.

paragraph.text: If any amount as adjusted under paragraph (1) is not a multiple of $10,000, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of $10,000.
The heading for section 2505 of such Code is amended by striking Unified.
The item in the table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 12 of such Code relating to section 2505 is amended to read as follows:
Section 2801(a)(1) of such Code is amended by striking section 2001(c) as in effect on the date of such receipt and inserting section 2502(a)(2).

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to gifts made on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.

paragraph.text: For purposes of applying sections 1015(d), 2502, and 2505 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, the calendar year in which this Act is enacted shall be treated as 2 separate calendar years one of which ends on the day before the date of the enactment of this Act and the other of which begins on such date of enactment.
For purposes of applying section 2504(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, the calendar year in which this Act is enacted shall be treated as one preceding calendar period.
